entry.title: Black Hat Python Networking: Sniffing
entry.summary:
Today is network sniffing day! I have talked about using Wireshark a few weeks ago, but what if you don't have Wireshark available to monitor a network traffic?

Again, Python comes with several solutions. Today I'm going to go through some of the Python's resources to deal with raw sockets and to write sniffers to view and decode network packets. This post is also based on Black Hat Python (continuing the series of posts in the subject).

Raw sockets access low-level networking information. For instance, we are able to check IP and ICMP headers, which are in the layer 3 of the OSI model, the network layer. We could even go lower to the layer 2, decoding Ethernet frames, for example, for attacks such as ARP poisoning.
